author: Tom Bryant
title: David Beckham hires crack squad of cyber spooks to hunt down £1million email hacker
text:
Showbiz David Beckham hires crack squad of cyber spooks to hunt down £1million email hacker The former England star's advisors have employed the services of cyber-security firm Marclay Associates to unmask the mastermind behind the theft of more than 18.6 million emails Share Get   
David Beckham ’s team have drafted in a crack squad of former spooks to track down the criminals who hacked and stole the cache of emails which have rocked the sporting world. 
His advisors have employed the services of cyber-security firm Marclay Associates to unmask the mastermind behind the theft of more than 18.6 million emails. 
And the Mirror can reveal that Becks’ PR chief Simon Oliveira has also spoken to the UK police with a view to them working alongside the ongoing Portugese investigation into the hack. 
A source said: “Contact has been made with cops in this country, too. There is a very good case for a UK investigation as it affects British citizens.” 
According to his biography, Marclay director Jake Hockley worked “as an operational officer to disrupt significant threats to UK National Security”. He left public service in 2012 to form the company. David Beckham smiles and waves to fans as he is seen out and about in London (Photo: Splash News) 
While James Tamblin, a consultant at the London-based firm, began his career as a covert military intelligence officer and has “experience of leadership in some of the world’s highest threat environments”. 
It is understood Marclay, who work with a number of private clients, have already had considerable success managing to close down at least three different Football Leaks accounts. 
Becks’ team have also drafted in police in Spain and Hungary, and are expected to call on German police, too. 
A source said: “Beckham’s team take this all very seriously indeed and have employed the best in the business. The Beckhams are standing united (Photo: Instagram) 
“[Marclay’s] background makes them ideal to try and sort out this mess and stem the flow of stolen information into the public domain.” 
Marclay Associates declined to comment. 
We revealed how Beckham’s business advisors were victims of a blackmail attempt early last year. They were asked to pay up to a millions euros – close to £1million – or face the disclosure of the emails. 
Hackers initially approached Portugal-based Doyen Sports, part of Mr Oliveira’s firm Doyen Global. Victoria Beckham is going about business as usual (Photo: GC Images) 
The team handed a dossier of evidence to Portuguese police, who have been probing the leak for 12 months. 
And the extraordinary lengths to which Beckham’s advisors went to unmask the hackers emerged. 
On the advice of the police, a meeting was set up at a petrol station on the outskirts of Portuguese capital Lisbon. 
Doyen Sports CEO Nelio Lucas and his lawyer met with a Porto-based lawyer called Anibal Pinto, said to have been acting for the alleged blackmailer, who wrote under the name Artem Lovuzov. 
Police had set up cameras at the petrol station and recorded the whole exchange as part of evidence of the extortion attempt. Victoria has posted loving family snaps (Photo: victoriabeckham/Instagram) 
Mr Pinto later claimed he had not helped Lobuzov to try to blackmail Lucas and that he was simply contacted “as a lawyer to agree a settlement with another lawyer”. 
He added: “When I realised that this agreement, or this attempt at an agreement, could constitute a crime, namely extortion, I abandoned the conversations, telling the other lawyer I was doing so and I advised my client, as I always do, to refrain from any activity that could be considered illegal.” 
The blackmailer had asked Mr Lucas for a “generous donation” of “something between €500,000 and a million” in return for hacked information being destroyed. 
When the extortion bid failed, the information was passed to the Football Leaks website, who have denied involvement in the blackmail.
